ThingDef.label: worm
ThingDef.description: Worms are any of the various slender, soft-bodied animals that live by burrowing underground, swimming in water, or as parasites. They have cylindrical, tube-like bodies and have no limbs. Notably, the most abundant creature called a "worm" are the creatures of the Annelid taxonomic phylum, all of which are segmented. The most famous of these are the earthworms, which were among the earliest creatures seeded by man in planets across the galaxy, some by accident. \n \n This type of worm in particular is especially treasured by the Gnomes, a subspecies of human. It is larger than most Annelid worms, is very meaty for its size, and it lacks any fowl, bitter, or undesirable taste or texture despite its slimy origins. Gnomes have used all types of Annelid worms as a cooking ingredient for thousands of years. Do not eat it raw.

ingestible.foodType: Meat, CarnivoreAnimal, CarnivoreAnimalStrict, OmnivoreAnimal, OmnivoreHuman, Corpse, Kibble

ThingDef.label: Gnome Root poppy products
ThingDef.description: The edible roots and seed pods of the Gnome Root poppy. They can be consumed directly or cooked, but they are principally ground up to make Gnome Flour, after which Gnome Fiber can be spun from the seed pod's husk, its leaves, and its stem.

ThingDef.label: gnome flour
ThingDef.description: Flour harvested from grinding the edible products of the Gnome Root poppy. Gnome flour has no actual distinction from gnome meal, except that it is set aside for the purpose of baking and breading. Gnome flour is not used as a general plant-based ingredient.

ThingDef.label: gnome meal
ThingDef.description: Flour harvested from grinding the edible products of the Gnome Root poppy. There is no difference between gnome meal and gnome flour. However, unlike gnome flour, gnome meal is not set aside for baking; it is used identically to any other plant-based ingredient.

ThingDef.label: Gnome Sugar
ThingDef.description: Harvested Gnome Sugar derived from the Gnome Sugarcane. It can be used in almost any situation where other types of sugar can be used, but some foods cannot be made with anything except Gnome Sugar.
